title: If I could give them a 0 stars, I would.
text: You don’t get extra vacation hours until 5 years with the company, insurance is higher than other places and that doesn’t even get into how awful day to day work is. For being a multi billion dollar company, their technology is ridiculous, and they can’t afford to have adequate staffing throughout the year. Constant changes in budget which make it hard to hire and keep a full staff. Corporate cares about metrics and has little to no interest in employee feedback. It has been constant misery with this company. Listen to the bad reviews on this one.

title: They did not care about their employees
text: Worse compensation of any company I have ever worked for. Was not family oriented. Management was poor. Morale was low.  Many weeks I worked my shift plus someone else's. The training within this company was poor and barely there. Promotions came only if you knew someone in management.

title: Busy retail pharmacy
text: Get ready to work hard everyday for your money. Management has unrealistic expectations and you are rarely appreciated. Turnover is crazy. Use this as an opportunity to pay your bills and look for a better paced store if you want to stay.

title: No payroll but tasks and regulation continue to increase
text: They continue to increase task and cut payroll. It is abusive how they treat salaried employees and don't give hourly employee stable hours each week.

title: It’s an ok company
text: Pay could be better. Supervisor and managers need better training. They think you are nothing and talk to you abt kind of way. They pay raises don’t happen.

title: Productive and fun work place
text: The location i work at is amazing, all staff is great, store manager is wonderful. Theres room for advancement. Starting pay is good. No complaints where i am at what so ever.

title: Not all rainbows
text: Honestly it depends on your location, but where I work it isn't that great. Our hours are constantly cut which means we do not have enough time to get everything accomplished that needs done. The cashier has more responsibilities than the managers sometimes, and the only full-time people are usually managers. If you get on part-time and they cut hours, it's better to just quit.

title: Great relationships with customers
text: The company cuts hours and leaves the pharmacy understaffed, having overworked technicians with low pay. The technicians deal with a lot to make 10$. And hour aren’t guaranteed. Never have time for yourself or a mental break. The pharmacy techs are overlooked in the company. The company seems to not care about the employees

title: Great place
text: Good place to work and gives you good benefits. Management were great and always helpful and good at coaching.  Sometimes stressful but was always a good team to be with

title: Stressful
text: If the pharmacist does not like you because you are not a young 25 year old, then good luck, will never receive any respect from her even tho you can work very hard and complete a lot of tasks required in the pharmacy

title: Not Worth It
text: Every single day was a living nightmare. We were always understaffed and we never had enough time to finish our work. The pharmacist would often work until 1 am to get stuff done. The pay was well under what was expected of me.

title: Terrible Company
text: The company expects alot and gives nothing. Its a dead end career with poor upper management that doesnt have a clue. They are so disorganized in every facet of their business. You can talk to 4 people and get 4 completely different answers. The only thing that matters to this company is how they will make the next buck from the next prescription.  They tried to talk me into staying to help them get through inventory and I would have lost all of my benefits in doing so.

title: Shift Supervisor
text: The work is exhausting, the customers will scream and yell because of coupons, you are expected to do all jobs including the pharmacy and cashier. If you do not go the extra mile your team and management will hate you. They have "rules" on how to limit and use coupons but when it comes down to it the district upper management will do anything to appease the customer even if that negatively impacts you. You are expected to work all kinds of shifts, even 730-12am if someone calls out. Good luck if you choose to work here.

title: DM liked intimidating everyone.
text: Terrible environment.  Being homeless would be better.  Intimidation was allowed. DM was horrible.  RM was a pompous jerk. VP allowed it all to continue. Had to spend so much time on iPad..pencil pushing.

title: diplomatic, stressful
text: Instead of helping others it is more a fight, who likes who,gets what is needed,wanted.  Dishonesty lies within and may cost you your job, blame is placed on others instance of acceptance from liable party. Unfair workplace ethic

title: Workplace
text: Great for first job and if you want something laid back or a second job because it’s not high pay you work more than you get paid. Only stated cause my store manager and staffs were cool.

title: After 11 years..
text: Worst company to ever work for. Would not recommend anyone I care about to work for this company. They don’t care about their employees. They don’t appreciate hard work and they treat you like ur just another number and easily replaceable

title: Absolutely terrible
text: Racist company . They don’t hire black people especially if it’s a majority Hispanic crew/ workers. facts avoid this company at all costs unless you really really really need the job

title: Not the best experience
text: I wouldn’t recommend working here unless you’re a teenager looking for experience. The requirements are demanding while the pay is not good. Not a place for smart people they are looking for a work horse.

title: Clerk/Cashier
text: Overall CVS is a good start of career specially if you’re someone looking to grow in the company. As long as you work and know how to work understand pressure and multitask, then you’ll enjoy working there. CVS I’d a people store therefore you have to be very polite and always always greet customers/patients.
